sections.heading: Core Function
sections.content:
は marks the topic of a sentence - what you're talking about.

Pronunciation: Written は but pronounced "wa"

私は学生です watashi wa gakusei desu "As for me, (I'm) a student"

children.heading: 1. Introducing Topics
children.content:
Set the context for your statement:

これは本です - "This is a book" 東京は大きいです - "Tokyo is big" 猫は好きです - "I like cats" (general statement)

children.heading: 2. Contrasting
children.content:
Implies "but not others":

寿司は好きですが、刺身は嫌いです "I like sushi, but I dislike sashimi" ビールは飲みますが、ワインは飲みません "I drink beer, but I don't drink wine"

Even without explicit contrast:

ビールは飲みます "I drink beer (but maybe not other things)"

children.heading: 3. General Statements
children.content:
Known or general information:

犬は動物です - "Dogs are animals" 水は大切です - "Water is important"

children.heading: 4. Existing Topics
children.content:
When the topic is already established:

A: 田中さんはどこですか？ "Where is Tanaka?" B: 田中さんは図書館です "Tanaka is at the library"

sections.heading: は vs が
sections.content:
Key differences:

| は (wa) | が (ga) | | ------------------ | ------------------ | | Sets topic/context | Identifies subject | | Known information | New information | | General statements | Specific emphasis | | Can show contrast | No contrast |

私は学生です "I am a student" (general statement) 私が学生です "I am the student" (emphasis: me specifically)

See: は vs が Explained

sections.heading: Position
sections.content:
Usually comes after the first or second word:

私は毎日勉強します "I study every day" 今日は雨です "Today it's raining"

sections.heading: With Other Particles
sections.content: は can replace が, を, but not に, で, へ:

children.heading: Replaces が
children.content: 雨が降る → 雨は降る "Rain falls" → "As for rain, it falls"

children.heading: Replaces を
children.content: 寿司を食べる → 寿司は食べる "Eat sushi" → "Sushi, I eat (but not other things)"

children.heading: Combines with に/で/へ
children.content: 東京には行きます (に + は = には) "To Tokyo, I'll go" 図書館では勉強しません (で + は = では) "At the library, I don't study"

children.heading: Topic + Description
children.content: 象は鼻が長い "Elephants have long trunks" (As for elephants, noses are long)

children.heading: Question-Answer
children.content: Q: 何を飲みますか？ "What will you drink?" A: 水を飲みます "I'll drink water" (answering what, not topic) But if asked about topic: Q: あなたは何を飲みますか？ A: 私は水を飲みます

sections.heading: Double は
sections.content:
Can have two は for double contrast:

私は魚は好きですが、肉は嫌いです "As for me, fish I like, but meat I dislike"

sections.heading: Omitting は
sections.content:
In casual speech, は often dropped when obvious:

Formal: 私は学生です Casual: 学生です "(I'm) a student"

sections.heading: Key Takeaways
sections.content:
✓ Marks the topic/context ✓ Written は, pronounced "wa" ✓ Creates contrast (implicit or explicit) ✓ Use for general statements ✓ Different from が (subject marker)

Related:

が (ga) - Subject Marker は vs が Explained Topic vs Subject
